top_categories.workout_context: 94ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
10,613ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
At The Rad Dirt Fest, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
The Rad Dirt Fest's High-desert gravel, Mesa terrain forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 113 miles.
Race-pace efforts that mimic The Rad Dirt Fest's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before September.
At mile 60 of 113, glycogen is gone. This workout teaches your body to produce watts on fumes.
10,613ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of The Rad Dirt Fest. Train it until it feels boring.
Every hard session works better with a bigger aerobic base. At 113 miles, base fitness is the difference between racing and surviving.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At The Rad Dirt Fest, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
Low-cadence force work for 10,613ft of climbing. The slow, grinding ascents where you can't spin—you push.
Endurance with intensity spikes baked in. Exactly what 10,613ft of climbing on high-desert gravel with long sustained climbs does to your power file on race day.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for The Rad Dirt Fest’s 113 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.altitude: The Rad Dirt Fest with 10,613ft of climbing, much of it above 8,000ft demands altitude preparation. Arrive 5–7 days early for acclimatization. Expect 5–15% power reduction at altitude. Increase iron intake 4 weeks out. Hydrate aggressively — altitude increases fluid loss by 20–40%. Altitude 6,000-9,000 ft.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at The Rad Dirt Fest requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on high-desert gravel with long sustained climbs to build confidence. Expect: high-desert gravel, mesa terrain, long sustained climbs.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, VO2max, and Over Under to prepare you for 113 miles of high-desert gravel with long sustained climbs in Trinidad, Colorado.
